name: Pesto Pasta Salad
description: Enjoy this Pesto Pasta Salad tossed with arugula, tomatoes, and fresh pesto for a picnic-perfect side dish. Vegan and easy to make gluten free, if needed.
recipeIngredient: 12 ounces uncooked short cut pasta (I used rotini)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the pasta to a large bowl. If using my homemade Vegan Pesto, make sure it's not too thick when you add it. Add additional water or olive oil and whisk first in a medium bowl, then add to the pasta and stir until the noodles are coated.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the pasta to a large bowl. If using my homemade Vegan Pesto, make sure it's not too thick when you add it. Add additional water or olive oil and whisk first in a medium bowl, then add to the pasta and stir until the noodles are coated.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the halved tomatoes, arugula and vegan cheese cubes, if using. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the halved tomatoes, arugula and vegan cheese cubes, if using. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

recipeInstructions.text: Right before serving, stir one more time, adding a little more olive oil or water if the mixture seems a bit dry. It can be stored in the refrigerator for 4-5 days. Enjoy!
